snippet: The Harvard scholar Ezra F. Vogel has written a major biography of Deng Xiaoping, Mao’s vice premier who later set China on its path of reform.

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: DENG XIAOPING AND THE TRANSFORMATION OF CHINA (BOOK)

lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. -- In 1979, just when Americans were beginning to reflect on the ascent of Japan, the Harvard University sociologist Ezra F. Vogel wrote his best-selling book, ''Japan as Number One: Lessons for America.'' Now, at age 81 and retired from Harvard as a professor emeritus, Mr. Vogel has written an equally compelling study of the rise of another Asian super power.

headline.main: Tracing the Life of Deng Xiaoping as a Man Who Changed China
